Jus Gentium.definition: a body of law recognized by nations that is binding and governs their relations with each other

1.1: a body of law recognized by nations that is binding and governs their relations with each other

2.note: In Roman lawjus gentiumreferred to the rules and laws that were common to the various nations or peoples under the Roman empire and were used in cases between non-Roman citizens or between a Roman and a non-Roman citizen.
